00139   static const double MSQ_SQRT_TWO = std::sqrt(2.0);

00167 #ifdef DBL_MIN
00168   const double MSQ_DBL_MIN = DBL_MIN;
00169 #else
00170   /* This value is rather large - DBL_MIN is normally about 2e-308 
00171      Put an error here to see if any platform really doesn't
00172      have DBL_MIN or DBL_MAX defined, and evaluate what to do then.
00173   */
00174   #error DBL_MIN not defined
00175   const double MSQ_DBL_MIN = 1.0E-30;
00176 #endif
00177   const double MSQ_MIN = MSQ_DBL_MIN;
00178   
00179 #ifdef DBL_MAX
00180   const double MSQ_DBL_MAX = DBL_MAX;
00181 #else
00182   /* This value is rather small - DBL_MAX is normally about 2e308 
00183      Put an error here to see if any platform really doesn't
00184      have DBL_MIN or DBL_MAX defined, and evaluate what to do then.
00185   */

00187   const double MSQ_DBL_MAX = 1.0E30;
00188 #endif    
00189   const double MSQ_MAX = MSQ_DBL_MAX;
00190   const double MSQ_MAX_CAP = 1.e6;
00191 
00192     //macro to return the min/max of a set of arguements.  The integer
00193     // (e.g., '2') tells how many arguements should be passed for comparison.
00194 template <class T> inline T MSQ_MIN_2(T a, T b) { return a < b ? a : b; }
00195 template <class T> inline T MSQ_MAX_2(T a, T b) { return a > b ? a : b; }
00196 
00197 
00198   // Utility functions
00199 inline double cbrt( double d ) 
00200 {
00201 #ifdef HAVE_CBRT
00202   return ::cbrt( d );
00203 #else
00204   return std::pow( d, MSQ_ONE_THIRD );
00205 #endif
00206 }
00207 
00208 inline double cbrt_sqr( double d )
00209 {
00210 #ifdef HAVE_CBRT
00211   return ::cbrt(d*d);
00212 #else
00213   return std::pow( d, MSQ_TWO_THIRDS );
00214 #endif
00215 }
00216 
00226 inline bool divide( double num, double den, double& result )
00227 {
00228   const double fden = fabs(den);
00229     // NOTE: First comparison is necessary to avoid overflow in second.
00230     // NOTE: Comparison in second half of condition must be '<'
00231     //       rather than '<=' to correctly handle 0/0.
00232   if (fden >= 1 || fabs(num) < fden*std::numeric_limits<double>::max()) {
00233     result = num/den;
00234     return true;
00235   }
00236   else {
00237     result = 0.0;
00238     return false;
00239   }
00240 }
00241   
00243 template <typename T> inline 
00244 T* arrptr( std::vector< T >& v, bool check_zero_size=false )
00245 {
00246   if (check_zero_size && !v.size()) return 0;
00247   assert(!v.empty());
00248   return &v[0];
00249 }
00250 template <typename T> inline 
00251 const T* arrptr( const std::vector< T >& v, bool check_zero_size=false )
00252 {
00253   if (check_zero_size && !v.size()) return 0;
00254   assert(!v.empty());
00255   return &v[0];
00256 }
